case.name: University of Western Australia v Gray (No 13) [2007] FCA 397 (20 March 2007)

citphrases.citphrase: validity of appointment of board members questioned
intractable conflict of interest in board members
assets only applicable for relevant charitable objects
power of court to make interlocutory appointment of receiver
receiver to conduct litigation or resolve it
assessment of damages for the loss of a commercial opportunity
whether legal costs recoverable as damages

citances.sentence: At a certain point in the proceedings, Sirtex sought to restrain the implementation and approval of a settlement between UWA and CRI; see University of Western Australia v Gray (No 10) [2007] FCA 377 ; University of Western Australia (No 13) [2007] FCA 397 ; Gray v Cancer Research Institute Inc [2007] FCAFC 149 ; Sirtex Medical Limited v Cancer Research Institute Inc [2008] HCA Trans 153.

3 The events leading up to the hearing before Graham J are more fully set out in the reasons for decision of French J in The University of Western Australia v Gray (No 13) [2007] FCA 397 ( Gray (No 13) ).
